thread.title: New Orleans Saints injuries: Terron Armstead returns on limited basis | NOLA.com
thread.title_full: New Orleans Saints injuries: Terron Armstead returns on limited basis | NOLA.com

author: Evan Woodbery, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: New Orleans Saints injuries: Terron Armstead returns on limited basis | NOLA.com
text:
New Orleans Saints offensive tackle Terron Armstead, who missed Sunday's game with a knee injury, returned to practice on a limited basis Tuesday, according to the team's official injury report.
Receiver Marques Colston (shoulder), guard Tim Lelito (shoulder), punter Thomas Morstead (right quadricep), defensive end Bobby Richardson (hip) and cornerback Damian Swann (concussion) all missed practice.
Safety Jairus Byrd (knee) and guard Jahri Evans (knee) were limited participants. Evans, who has missed three consecutive games, said he planned to return on Thursday when the Saints (1-4) play the Atlanta Falcons (5-0) at the Mercedes-Benz Superdome.
Saints defensive tackle John Jenkins (elbow) was a full participant in practice on Tuesday after being estimated as limited on Monday.
For the Falcons, linebacker Justin Durant (elbow), center Mike Person (ankle) and receiver Julio Jones (toe, hamstring) did not participate in Tuesday's practice.
Falcons coach Dan Quinn expressed confidence that Jones would play .
Atlanta running back Devonta Freeman (toe) and receiver Leonard Hankerson were limited in Tuesday's practice.
